title: Increase in global weather temperatures
desc: Since the Industrial Revolution the global temperature has been rising. Human activity is mainly responsible for this, as well as some natural variability. It is a major aspect of climate change.

title: Albedo Impact
desc: Measure of reflection of solar radiation on surfaces. Dark surfaces (ocean, forest, soil) have low albedo and absorb most of the light, whereas light surfaces (ice, snow) have a high albedo and reflect more (of it/light).

title: Increase in global CO2 levels

title: Increase in global sea levels
desc: Rising sea levels are provoked by melting ice sheets or glaciers and thermal expansion of warming sea water. This climate change effect greatly influences coastal habitats.
